channel.title: Rs317
channel.description:
[center][b][u]RS317[/u][/b][/center]
Since all the current servers are an absolute mess, I have decided to create my own from scratch. I currently have nothing to show, but that is because it is only a framework, and is [u][b]VERY[/b][/u] basic. Here is what it contains:
[ul][li]Server starts and binds to a port that is defined at run time[/li] [li]Server receives the connections even though it doesn't handle them.[/li] [li]Started receiving and writing packets[/li] [li]Started working player loading.[/li][/ul]
As of right now, all connection handling just uses Sockets and Server Sockets, but I will eventually switch it over to NIO. This might take a while, because I have to actually learn to use NIO first.
[URL=http://img176.imageshack.us/my.php?image=loginbeginninguh2.jpg][IMG]http://img176.imageshack.us/img176/9476/loginbeginninguh2.th.jpg[/img][/URL]

item.title: Rs317
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote="_Vengeance, post:55, topic:253692"][quote author=Intern link=topic=335153.msg2708620#msg2708620 date=1237149858]
For everyone here who thinks he just created 1 class, your retarded.
[/quote]

My retarded?

Even if you create a socket listener and start the server on a port, the client will just return an error in the login screen. At least his logs in. Meaning he has some general knowledge of how to write a decent login system. Good work in my opinion.

Anyone could write up a login server in < 1 hour if they wanted to.

And

[quote author=ollie123 link=topic=335153.msg2709218#msg2709218 date=1237188369]
Why did you gravedig a 2-month old topic?
[/quote][/quote]I wasn’t talking about you Jordan.

Read full topic

item.title: Rs317
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

Why create another 317 framework when there is already at least 2 decent ones around? take rs2dv, its a very decent structure and uses MINA, the core is handled and being single threaded you won’t run into any threading problems, plus his framework has proven stable at 500+ concurrent players (yes i have seen this with my own eyes).

Read full topic

item.title: Rs317
item.dc:creator: @_Patrick +Patrick
item.description:
@_Patrick wrote:

M.Dog, you say your starting in I/O at first? Why don’t you use NIO? And what will this server be using for example mySQL database loading? If you are, you’ll have to redo it so it can run off the DB. I would prefer using mySQL as it is more easier to load and what have you…And a slight suggestion on creating your Packets. Use them in a HashMap and synchronize them externally. ^^

Read full topic
